title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 579.5 - Traffic regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 579.5 - Traffic regulations

State Regulations
(a) The
college council of each State University shall adopt campus rules and
regulations, not inconsistent with the Vehicle and Traffic Law, relating to
vehicular parking, vehicular and pedestrian traffic and safety. All such rules
shall be submitted to the SUNY office of the university counsel for review and
action. (b) Traffic regulations on
campus roadways are posted in accordance with the Manual of Uniform Traffic

Controls. The maximum permissible speed is 25 miles per hour
(radar-controlled). No person shall operator a vehicle on college streets, roads or highways at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent with
regarding to the existing weather and road conditions. A full stop at all stop
signs is required; pedestrians have the right-of-way; and yield signs must be
strictly observed. (c) University
police officers are empowered to enforce all ordinances and laws pertaining to
traffic regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
579.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
